commands.name: atmos help
commands.summary: Show help for all atmos commands
commands.description: `atmos help` shows help for all atmos CLI commands.

commands.name: atmos aws eks update-kubeconfig
description: This command executes `aws eks update-kubeconfig` command to download `kubeconfig` from an EKS cluster and save it to a file.
The command can execute `aws eks update-kubeconfig` in three different ways:
1. If all the required parameters (cluster name and AWS profile/role) are provided on the command-line, then `atmos` executes the command without requiring the `atmos` CLI config and context.
2. If `component` and `stack` are provided on the command-line, then `atmos` executes the command using the `atmos` CLI config and stack's context by searching for the following settings:
- `components.helmfile.cluster_name_pattern` in `atmos.yaml` CLI config (and calculates the `--name` parameter using the pattern)
- `components.helmfile.helm_aws_profile_pattern` in `atmos.yaml` CLI config (and calculates the `--profile` parameter using the pattern)
- the variables for the component in the provided stack
- `region` from the variables for the component in the stack
3. Combination of the above. Provide a component and a stack, and override other parameters on the command line.
exampleCommands: atmos aws eks update-kubeconfig --alias <cluster context name alias>

options.name: profile
options.summary: AWS profile to use to authenticate to the EKS cluster

options.name: role-arn
options.summary: AWS IAM role ARN to use to authenticate to the EKS cluster

options.name: kubeconfig
options.summary: A `kubeconfig` filename to append with the configuration

options.name: alias
options.summary: Alias for the cluster context name. Defaults to match cluster ARN

options.name: dry-run
options.summary: Print the merged kubeconfig to stdout instead of writing it to the specified file

options.name: verbose
options.summary: Print more detailed output when writing to the kubeconfig file, including the appended entries

commands.name: atmos describe config
commands.description: This command shows the final (deep-merged) CLI configuration.
